primary.request: Pay maintenance fee for specific contract
primary.context: Caller has multiple properties and the AI previously sent the wrong payment link (Cliffs at Peace Canyon) instead of the requested one (Vacation Village in the Berkshires).
primary.detail: The agent confirmed the correct contract number and contact details, then stated it was getting the link ready to send.

secondary.context: Caller wants a backup number in case the automated link fails again.
secondary.detail: The agent provided general instructions to call the main customer service line.

steps: Caller explains that a previous call resulted in the wrong payment link being sent.
Caller provides the specific contract number for the property they wish to pay.
Agent identifies the caller and confirms the specific intent to pay the Berkshires contract.
Agent offers a transfer for the technical glitch, but caller opts to try the automated system one more time.
Agent performs account lookup and verification (state).
Agent confirms contact information on file.
Agent confirms the link is being prepared for the correct contract.
Agent provides general contact info for live support upon request.

clarifications.note: Agent confirms specific property to avoid repeating previous error.

actions.detail: Prepared payment link for Vacation Village in the Berkshires.

insights.summary: The caller was frustrated because a previous interaction sent a payment link for the wrong property. The agent successfully isolated the correct contract, verified the user, and sent the requested link while providing a backup contact method.
insights.verbatim: I gave you the contract number for Vacation Village in the Berkshires, and what I was sent was one of my other timeshares called Cliffs at Peace Canyon.
insights.coaching: The agent handled a repeat-caller error well by proactively confirming the specific property name to ensure the second attempt was accurate.
